Data, too much, too soon

Recently I have a very sharp idea change about my data.

Like for years, maybe more precisely, from I was in high school, I have been taking regular notes about my mental state. Well, to be honest, it’s a strange behaviour, it’s like if you are healthy everyday you don’t need no record. Or you don’t need to take notes on the level of back pain if you don’t have any. I take notes on mental states because I absolutely feel abnormal, feel I’m so different from other people (the most stupid thing is that I’ve gone though like 24 years without a proper idea of my ADHD traits, while maybe a bit knowledge about my ASD personality), but was actually treated and required as the normal people concept.

You can imagine it like, you are a pegion but not allowed to fly, because other chicken might be jealous or scared. They peck you after every flight, then gradually you are trained to transport walking like them. But the desire never disappear right? It’s the instinct. A pegion must fly unless they lose their wings. A conflict from the environment.

After years of recording, I finally realized, all the data, well, they are useless. Because I don’t even understand a single word form such an old time like 10 years ago. I have lost the mindset and every knowledge that might help me understand the meaning behind. That’s a pity, sadly, my data died. Just like I will be totally lost if asked what have you ate for breakfast 3 days ago.

Data have their own expiration date.
